Quoting Erik Hanson <yahoogroups@...>:

> <steven.hale@...> wrote:
> > Does junit make debuggers obsolete? Are there situations where junit in
> > partnership with logging isn't sufficient?
> 
> In my experience, unit testing makes logging obsolete and makes the
> debugger much more powerful.

If you can test all possibilities, then logging is obsolete.  Otherwise logging
is still very useful to get feedback from a problem and help reproduce it
(typically log the pre and post conditions).

Without logging you'll have to ask your customer: "it's not working, but what
did you do _exactly_?".  Most of the time he won't remember _exactly_ and you
won't be able to reproduce the bug, and unable to fix it.

-Vladimir
